intro: Flabellaria paniculata var. mollis, commonly known as the soft-flowered flabellaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in paniculate inflorescences, and bloom during the rainy season. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
